definition: five notes of pentatonic scale, roughly do, re, mi, sol, la/five classes of initial consonants of Chinese phonetics, namely: 喉音[hou2 yin1], 牙音[ya2 yin1], 舌音[she2 yin1], 齒音|齿音[chi3 yin1], 唇音[chun2 yin1]
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
tone deaf/unable to sing in tune

sentences.english: She is a very poor singer but she thinks she's the bee's knees.
sentences.chinese: 她五音不全卻自認爲是高高在上的一流歌手。

sentences.english: But the crazy thing is that people still do go just to be a spectator at other people's inability to sing.
sentences.chinese: 事就是人們還得繼續當聽衆聽他們五音不全的唱歌。

sentences.english: The music was strictly regulated with the five tones and six pitches.
sentences.chinese: 音樂被五音六律等嚴格地規範。

sentences.english: You don't want me to sing in the choir, I can't carry a tune.
sentences.chinese: 你甭想叫我到唱詩班去唱歌，我五音不全啊。

sentences.english: Whose household words are songs in many keys.
sentences.chinese: 它們的家常話是五音繁會的歌聲。

sentences.english: His song is out of the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 歌聲更是荒腔走板，五音不全。

sentences.english: How many of you know what iambic pentameter is?
sentences.chinese: 你們有多少人知道抑揚格的五音步格詩？

definition: pre-Tang names of the five notes of the pentatonic scale, corresponding roughly to do, re, mi, sol, la

ancient classification system for musical instruments, based on the material of which the instrument is made (metal 金, stone 石, clay 土, leather 革, silk 絲|丝, wood 木, gourd 匏, bamboo 竹)/the eight kinds of sound produced by instruments in these categories/music
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
tone deaf/unable to sing in tune
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
